argument.description: The string to convert to uppercase.

returnType: The UPPER function returns a string value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL UPPER function converts all letters in the specified string to uppercase. If there are characters in the string that are not letters, they are unaffected by this function.
sample:
UPPER('Tech on the Net')
Result: 'TECH ON THE NET'

UPPER('george burns 123   ')
Result: 'GEORGE BURNS 123   '
